Description: Stone shabti of Iuy (?), overseer of cattle of Amun of Hsbw(?) (the 11th Lower Egyptian province), with an incised curled lappet-wig, a modelled face and parallel hands in relief; the chest is covered by a representation of a Ba-bird; the figure wears a kilt with a triangular pleated apron inscribed with a column of incised hieroglyphs; the feet are shown separately upon a plinth.
Curator's comments: Note that the spelling of the nome in the title is unclear. Both the 6th Lower Egyptian province (Xois) and the 11th Lower Egyptian province (Hsbw) were written with a bull (on a standard) but with different attributes; the mountain sign (N26) in the former, the pustule (Aa2) in the latter. Although Amun is known to be the main deity in Xois, the palaeography of the last sign resembles spelling of the 11th Lower Egyptian province (bull on standard with the pustule-sign)
